Key Match Events: Kylian Mbappé scored a penalty to break his Euros duck
Robert Lewandowski scored a penalty for Poland to equalize
Pre-Game Insights: Kylian Mbappé was masked up and playing despite a broken nose
France needed to win to have any chance of finishing top of Group B
Poland was already eliminated and playing without constraints
Post-Match Reflections: France finish second in Group D at Euro 2024
France had 55 touches in Poland’s penalty area, the second-highest in Euros history since 1980
France failed to score an open-play goal despite dominating possession
Poland avoided defeat in a game where they conceded first for just the third time at the Euros
Kylian Mbappé became the first France player to score at this year’s UEFA European Championship
Poland striker Robert Lewandowski became the third player to score in four different editions of the UEFA European Championship
Miscellaneous Highlights: France failed to win their final group stage match at a major tournament for a ninth consecutive tournament
Poland have failed to win any of the five games in which Robert Lewandowski has scored at the UEFA European Championship
N’Golo Kanté has lost none of his 11 games at the UEFA European Championship
Antoine Griezmann made his 33rd appearance for France at a major international tournament
Others: France’s poor performance raises questions for the upcoming knockout stages
